verses.verse: To the chief Musician<WH5329> upon Shoshannim<WH7799>, for the sons<WH1121> of Korah<WH7141>, Maschil<WH4905>, A Song<WH7892> of loves<WH3039>. My heart<WH3820> is inditing<WH7370> a good<WH2896> matter<WH1697>: I speak<WH559> of the things which I have made<WH4639> touching the king<WH4428>: my tongue<WH3956> is the pen<WH5842> of a ready<WH4106> writer<WH5608>.
Thou art fairer<WH3302> than the children<WH1121> of men<WH120>: grace<WH2580> is poured<WH3332> into thy lips<WH8193>: therefore God<WH430> hath blessed<WH1288> thee for ever<WH5769>.
Gird<WH2296> thy sword<WH2719> upon thy thigh<WH3409>, O most mighty<WH1368>, with thy glory<WH1935> and thy majesty<WH1926>.

And in thy majesty<WH1926> ride<WH7392> prosperously<WH6743> because<WH1697> of truth<WH571> and meekness<WH6037> and righteousness<WH6664>; and thy right hand<WH3225> shall teach<WH3384> thee terrible things<WH3372>.
Thine arrows<WH2671> are sharp<WH8150> in the heart<WH3820> of the king's<WH4428> enemies<WH341>; whereby the people<WH5971> fall<WH5307> under thee.
Thy throne<WH3678>, O God<WH430>, is for ever<WH5769> and ever<WH5703>: the sceptre<WH7626> of thy kingdom<WH4438> is a right<WH4334> sceptre<WH7626>.

Thou lovest<WH157> righteousness<WH6664>, and hatest<WH8130> wickedness<WH7562>: therefore God<WH430>, thy God<WH430>, hath anointed<WH4886> thee with the oil<WH8081> of gladness<WH8342> above thy fellows<WH2270>.
All thy garments<WH899> smell of myrrh<WH4753>, and aloes<WH174>, and cassia<WH7102>, out of the ivory<WH8127> palaces<WH1964>, whereby<WH4482> they have made thee glad<WH8055>.
Kings'<WH4428> daughters<WH1323> were among thy honourable women<WH3368>: upon thy right hand<WH3225> did stand<WH5324> the queen<WH7694> in gold<WH3800> of Ophir<WH211>.
Hearken<WH8085>, O daughter<WH1323>, and consider<WH7200>, and incline<WH5186> thine ear<WH241>; forget<WH7911> also thine own people<WH5971>, and thy father's<WH1> house<WH1004>;
So shall the king<WH4428> greatly desire<WH183> thy beauty<WH3308>: for he is thy Lord<WH113>; and worship<WH7812> thou him.
And the daughter<WH1323> of Tyre<WH6865> shall be there with a gift<WH4503>; even the rich<WH6223> among the people<WH5971> shall intreat<WH2470> thy favour<WH6440>.
The king's<WH4428> daughter<WH1323> is all glorious<WH3520> within<WH6441>: her clothing<WH3830> is of wrought<WH4865> gold<WH2091>.
She shall be brought<WH2986> unto the king<WH4428> in raiment of needlework<WH7553>: the virgins<WH1330> her companions<WH7464> that follow<WH310> her shall be brought<WH935> unto thee.
With gladness<WH8057> and rejoicing<WH1524> shall they be brought<WH2986>: they shall enter<WH935> into the king's<WH4428> palace<WH1964>.
Instead of thy fathers<WH1> shall be thy children<WH1121>, whom thou mayest make<WH7896> princes<WH8269> in all the earth<WH776>.
I will make thy name<WH8034> to be remembered<WH2142> in all<WH1755> generations<WH1755>: therefore shall the people<WH5971> praise<WH3034> thee for ever<WH5769> and ever<WH5703>.
